The '''Trout Bend''' was a river valley that lay between the [[Rhovanion Hills|hills]] of [[Rhovanion]] and an unnamed range of hills just slightly north of the [[Mordor|Southlands]]. The Trout Bend was invented for ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]'' by [[Amazon Studios]].

== Geography ==
The Trout Bend was named for the bend in a illegibly named river (--OG) that originated just at the eastern end of the river valley.

== History ==
In the late [[Second Age]], the Trout Bend was a location that a certain [[Harfoots|Harfoot community]] passed by when migrating from one seasonal haven to the next, particularly from the [[Norfield Glen]] to the [[Grove]].

During one such migration, the Brandyfoot family, [[Poppy Proudfellow]], and [[The Stranger]] crossed above a waterfall following after the main caravan of the Harfoot community which was far ahead of them.

Later, a group of three [[Mystics]] possibly passed through the Trout Bend when they were stalking the Harfoot migration trail, seeking to find the Stranger.
